Blog

Technical writing on R, data science, and research computing
Author
Affiliation

Ronald (Ryy) Glenn Thomas

UCSD

A collection of technical articles, tutorials, and explorations covering R programming, data science methodologies, and research computing workflows.

💡 Use the category cloud below to filter posts by topic, or use the search box to find specific content.

1 All Available Tags

Explore content by topic. Tags with posts will show in the automatic filter below, but here’s the complete collection based on current R/biostatistics community trends:

1.1 Core R & Programming

R Programming • Data Science • ggplot2 • Shiny • Python • Data Visualization • Statistical Computing • R Packages

1.2 Statistical Methods

Machine Learning • Bayesian Methods • Time Series Analysis • PCA (Principal Component Analysis) • Statistical Learning • Forecasting • Dimensionality Reduction • Neural Networks • ARIMA/GARCH Models • Correlation Analysis

1.3 Biostatistics & Medical

Biostatistics • Clinical Trials • Survival Analysis • Epidemiology • Healthcare Analytics • Medical Research • Drug Development • Prevention Trials

1.4 Domain Applications

Financial Analysis • Spatial Analysis • Environmental Statistics • Genomics • Neuroimaging • Ecological Statistics • Computational Methods

1.5 Emerging Technologies

Large Language Models • AI/Machine Learning • Open Science • Predictive Modeling • Simulation

1.6 Specialized Research Areas

Military Health • Healthcare • COVID-19 • Alzheimer’s Disease • Sleep Research • Cognitive Assessment • Pharmacokinetics

July 1, 2025 Research Compendia for Full Reproducibility in R: A zzrrtools, renv, draft: true and Docker Strategy This white paper presents an approach to achieving reproducibility in R workflows by combining three tools: zzrrtools for creating structured research compendia, renv for R package management, and Docker for containerizing the computing environment. The zzrrtools framework provides a standardized research compendium structure, renv manages package dependencies, and Docker ensures consistent execution environments. Together, these tools create self-contained research compendia that run identically across different systems. The paper includes a practical case study demonstrating multi-developer collaborative workflows with clear governance roles, where a project maintainer manages the technical infrastructure while multiple contributors extend the research analysis.
